title: The Mummy Diaries: Greg Shepherd tries to make paella but forgets to cook the rice
text:
Greg Shepherd tries to win husband points by cooking his wife Billie Faiers a paella during their Spanish holiday in Wednesday's installment of The Mummy Diaries.

However his attempt to serve the Valencian rice dish fails miserably when he forgets to cook the rice, leaving his chicken raw.

A quick-thinking Greg, 34, tries to hoodwink Billie, 29, and her mum Sue by ordering a chicken paella takeaway and pleads with Nelly, five, and Arthur, two, to not tell them.

Doing his best: Greg Shepherd tries to win husband points by cooking his wife Billie Faiers a paella during their Spanish holiday in Wednesday's installment of The Mummy Diaries

The reality star realises his Spanish is limited and turns to Google translate find out what chicken paella for four people is.

With the translation in hand, Greg calls up the nearest takeaway and using 'Span-glish' manages to place an order, with phrases like 'rapido' and 'un second'.

He then turns to Nelly and Arthur and says: 'We're not going to let mummy and nanny know, yeah?'

Oh dear: A quick-thinking Greg, 34, tries to hoodwink Billie, 29, and her mum Sue by ordering a chicken paella takeaway

Epic fail: However his attempt to serve the Valencian rice dish fails miserably when he forgets to cook the rice, leaving his chicken raw

Language barrier: The reality star realises his Spanish is limited and turns to Google translate find out what chicken paella for four people is

Guilty: He pleads with Nelly, five, and Arthur, two, to not tell them: 'We're going to pretend I have cooked it and you two have to be on my side and pretend yeah?'

'We're going to pretend I have cooked it and you two have to be on my side and pretend yeah?

'You won't tell them will you?'

But his masterplan ends in disaster when the takeaway delivery guy enters the apartment with Billie and Sue.

Caught red-handed: But his masterplan ends in disaster when the takeaway delivery guy enters the apartment with Billie and Sue

Takeaway: Billie tells him: 'Greg, the guy downstairs said you ordered two paellas? He's here. I thought you were meant to be making it'

Billie tells him: 'Greg, the guy downstairs said you ordered two paellas? He's here. I thought you were meant to be making it.'

Looking sheepish, Greg tells the camera: 'The guy walked through the door with paellas in his hand and I've been caught red handed.'

He then tells Billie: 'I was making it but it's gone wrong. I don't think I'll ever attempt to make paella again.'

The Mummy Diaries continues on Wednesday on ITVBe at 9pm.
description: Greg Shepherd tries to win husband points by cooking his wife Billie Faiers a paella during their Spanish holiday in Wednesday's installment of The Mummy Diaries.
